driveSystems
Class CaliforniaDrive

java.lang.Object
  driveSystems.DriveSystem
      driveSystems.CaliforniaDrive

public class CaliforniaDrive
extends DriveSystem

A class for a california drive. It cannot move sideways or move relative to the field.

Author:
Colin Poler

CaliforniaDrive

public CaliforniaDrive(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController[] motors,
                       double[] motorCoefficients)
Constructs a california drive from the specified motors, and motor coefficients.

Parameters:
motors - The motors to be used by the swerve drive.
motorCoefficients - The motor coefficients to be used by the swerve drive.
Method Detail

checkMotors

protected void checkMotors(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController[] motors)
Checks if the array of motors is valid.

Overrides:
checkMotors in class DriveSystem
Parameters:
motors - The motors that were passed to the constructor.

checkMovement

protected void checkMovement(Movement movement)
Checks that the movement given to move() is valid. It should be overridden by a DriveSystem if it cannot move in a certain way, especially for non-holomonic drives.

Overrides:
checkMovement in class DriveSystem
Parameters:
movement - The movement given to move().

updateMovement

protected void updateMovement()
Updates the motors to the most recent movement.

Specified by:
updateMovement in class DriveSystem
